definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
various genera of flowers of Asteracea family (daisies and chrysanthemums), including Atractylis lancea

sentences.english: Many people think it would be nice to have the Midas touch.
sentences.chinese: 很多人认为如果有点金术会很不错。

sentences.english: If you know how to spend less than you get, you have the philosophers' stone.
sentences.chinese: 如果你知道如何支出少于收入，你就有了点金术。

sentences.english: What is the alchemy of fear breaking?
sentences.chinese: 冲破恐惧的点金术究竟是什么东西？
他拥有迈达斯的点金术。

sentences.english: Old Mr. Wilson is lousy with money. He must have possessed some sort of alchemy.
sentences.chinese: 韦尔逊老先生尹腰缠万贯，他准是掌握了什么点金术。

sentences.english: Traders with the golden touch do not talk.
sentences.chinese: 有点金术的交易商稀于言谈。

definition: to touch base matter and turn it to gold (idiom); fig. to turn crude writing into a literary gem
to touch base matter and turn it to gold (idiom); fig. to turn crude writing into a literary gem
lit. to change something rotten into something magical (idiom)
pinyin: hua4 fu3 xiu3 wei2 shen2 qi2

definition: magic transformation performed by Daoist immortal/fig. to reveal/to enlighten
effective cure, miracle medicine (idiom); fig. wonder-cure for all problems/panacea/elixir
various genera of flowers of Asteracea family (daisies and chrysanthemums), including Atractylis lancea
money is all-powerful/money can move God
petty thief (lit. quick fingered and vanish)/empty-handed/having nothing
